Module project.notizprogrammrepository
Package project.notizprogrammrepository.view.Calendar.Week

Class WeekView

java.lang.Object
project.notizprogrammrepository.view.Calendar.Week.WeekView
public class WeekView extends Object
A view-component for a week.

  • Field Details

    • width

      private double width
      The width of the component.

    • height

      private double height
      The height of the component.

    • root

      private final javafx.scene.layout.VBox root
      The root VBox containing all other components.

    • weekDayNameDisplay

      private final javafx.scene.layout.HBox weekDayNameDisplay
      A HBox containing labels for all weekdays. The weekdays are represented in their shortened form + the day-number respective to the month(ex. wed 3). Each label takes up 1/7 of the width and 1/7 of the height.

    • days

      private final javafx.scene.layout.HBox days
      A HBox containing all dayViews of the represented week.

    • currentWeek

      private Day[] currentWeek
      The current week.

    • entryClickHandler

      private final javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> entryClickHandler
      The handler for clicks on EntryButtons in DayInWeekViews.

    • controller

      private final Controller controller
      The Controller used for access to the data.

    • segmentView

      private final SegmentView segmentView
      The SegmentView the component is a part of.

  • Constructor Details

    • WeekView

      public WeekView(double x, double y, double width, double height, Day[] week, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> entryClickHandler, Controller controller, SegmentView segmentView)
      Creates a WeekView of the given size at the given position with the given values.
      Parameters:
      x - The x position of the component.
      y - The y position of the component.
      width - The width of the component.
      height - The height of the component.
      week - The week the component represents.
      entryClickHandler - The handler for clicks on EntryButtons in DayInWeekViews.
      controller - The Controller used for access to the data.
      segmentView - The SegmentView the component is a part of.

  • Method Details

    • resize

      public void resize(double x, double y, double width, double height)
      Changes the size and position of all components respective to the given values.
      Parameters:
      x - The new x position of the component.
      y - The new y position of the component.
      width - The new width of the component.
      height - The new height of the component.

    • changeContents

      public void changeContents(Day[] week)
      Changes the days-HBoxes contents to the values of the given week.
      Parameters:
      week - The new week to be represented by the component.

    • getWeekDayLabels

      private ArrayList<javafx.scene.control.Label> getWeekDayLabels()
      Returns the labels of the weekdays and number of the day in the month.
      Returns:
      The labels of the weekdays.

    • resizeWeekDayLabels

      private void resizeWeekDayLabels()
      Sets the size of the weekday-labels respective to the components width and height.

    • getDays

      private ArrayList<javafx.scene.Node> getDays()
      Returns an ArrayList of nodes containing a representation for the days of currentWeek. Each of the 7 elements is either a DayInWeekView ora rectangle with 1/7 of the width and 5/7 of the height in size.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of nodes containing a representation for the days of currentWeek.

    • resizeDays

      private void resizeDays()
      Sets the size of the days respective to the components width and height.

    • getRoot

      public javafx.scene.layout.VBox getRoot()
      Returns the root VBox of the component.
      Returns:
      The root VBox of the component.
